Google has shocked it's shareholders by announcing that Eric Schmidt , it's current CEO will step down in April and co-founder Larry Page replace him in the Chief Executive Officer role. There has also been talk of tension between Eric Schmidt and Page on competing priorities, Seth Harris added, with Eric Schmidt emphasizing the need to protect margins and Page pushing for more innovation. Google has to do both but is losing talent and facing tough competition, so the balance is tough to reach, he concluded. All of this is true, but replacing Eric Schmidt with Page is not necessarily the answer, said Seth Harris Dalka, a digital strategy consultant and keynote speaker.
